title: R package for sending coded messages
text: package uses Caesar cypher letter gets different shift. Additionally, message gets different set shifts based 3 number code start message. first 3 numbers indicate cypher used, indicates shift used every character. utf8 codes converted integers caesar shift added. decoding, first 3 numbers read used find correct cypher, integers shifted, allowing integers converted back utf8 coding.

title: R package for sending coded messages
code: cypher_code <- function(x) {   cn <- round(runif(1, 1, 999))   x <- paste(c(as.numeric(stringr::str_pad(cn, 3, pad = "0")), utf8ToInt(x) + utf8ToInt(substr(cyphers[cn], 1, nchar(x)))), collapse = " ")   x } cypher_decode <- function(x) {   x <- as.numeric(unlist(strsplit(x, split = " ")))   cn <- x[1]   intToUtf8(x[2:length(x)] - utf8ToInt(substr(cyphers[cn], 1, length(x)-1))) }
